column1: Tangerang (Sundanese: ᮒᮍᮨᮛᮀ) is a city in the province of Banten

column3: it is the third largest urban centre in the Greater Jakarta metropolitan area after Jakarta and Bekasi; the sixth largest city proper in the nation; and the largest city in Banten province. column1: Tangerang is home for Soekarno–Hatta International Airport which serves the Jakarta metropolitan area and is Indonesia's main gateway.
Tangerang is an industrial and manufacturing hub on Java and is home to over 1
column2: 000 factories. Many international corporations have plants in the city. Tangerang tends to be hot and humid
column3: with little in the way of trees or geographical features. Certain areas consist of swamps
column4: including the areas near the Soekarno–Hatta International Airport.

column1: Tangerang District is the location of the Situ Gintung reservoir built by the Dutch colonial authorities in 1933. It was surrounded by a dam up to 16 metres (52 ft) high
column2: which failed on 27 March 2009 with the resulting floods killing at least 93 people.

column1: Boen Tek Bio is the oldest Chinese temple
column3: in Tangerang – with a history going back to 1684.

column1: Next to Boen Tek Bio is the Benteng Heritage Museum
column2: a historic townhouse that was restored and repurposed as a museum by a Benteng Chinese businessman Udaya Halim. It was opened on a specifically chosen auspicious date: November 11
column3: 2011 or 11/11/11. The museum displays Benteng Chinese artefacts and other cultural objects related to the history of Tangerang's Chinese community.

column1: In 2007 the city government passed an anti-prostitution law which meant that women who are perceived to be dressed too provocatively may be arrested. Some news outlets reported that some women decided to wear the jilbab (hijab) to avoid being prosecuted under this law. In addition the city government began requiring municipal employees to abide by Islamic dress codes.

Soekarno-Hatta International Airport is the main hub for air transport in Jakarta Metropolitan Area as well as Tangerang.
Air-conditioned public bus shuttle is available from the airport to destinations in Jakarta. This is operated by DAMRI
There are private shuttle bus services from Jakarta to private residential area such as Lippo Karawaci and Citra Raya.
